content.prompt: A satellite is in a counterclockwise elliptical orbit around a planet, as shown in the figure. The satellite is shown at two positions along its orbit, Point A and Point B. As the satellite moves from Point A to Point B, what happens to the angular momentum of the satellite about the planet, and what reasoning supports the claim?
